content.description: If you've been looking for a sustained 10" wide crack to practice your off-width skills in the Inland Northwest, then this is it.  This dirty crack will wear you down and spit you out five feet from the bottom.  The climbing eases up once the crack offsets into a flared chimney.
content.protection: A couple old pitons down low and any big boys that can protect 10-12" if you have them.  Otherwise you could set up a top rope from the tree above.
content.location: Located on the Troll Tower halfway up a heavy vegetated slope to the right of the Flying Squirrel Buttress is the obvious crack of the Ogre.

content.description: Starts off with a large right facing hand crack on a boulder out of the ground then heads straight up to the roof above.  Work your way around the horn past the fixed nut and then straight up to the chains.
content.location: Located on the Flying Squirrel Buttress, this route is under the obvious roof that is just right of the slanting right facing diehedral of beeline.

content.description: Follow the low angled right facing diehedral up to a tree.  You'll figure out how this route got its name when you're about two thirds the way up on a sunny day.
content.protection: Gear to 1" finishes at a large pine tree.
content.location: the right facing diehedral on the Flying Squirrel Buttress.
